text: I encourage you to instead think of the reader experience. Is the post meant to be consumed by the reader non-linearly? Or does it detail a process where readers may have already completed the first few steps (and thus would want to skip to the value ASAP)? Or is the post so complicated that you want to signal to the reader what is coming up to set expectations? Then do it.

elements.text: I encourage you to instead think of the reader experience. Is the post meant to be consumed by the reader non-linearly? Or does it detail a process where readers may have already completed the first few steps (and thus would want to skip to the value ASAP)? text: If you have a high-quality study, have you tried publishing it to your own site and then releasing a press release announcing your results and describing your methodology? HubSpot is <https://www.hubspot.com/company-news/2020-remote-work-report|great at this>. You could also put a little ad spend behind it to generate some interest. Target editors/journalists in your industry.
